page.title: 17Media-Entertainment-Clubs
page.content: Entertainment in the home is most often the television and video equipment. This also provides a window on the outside world. Home based entertainment has largely disappeared. The villager takes full advantage of the radio and the newspapers and journals that come in from the outside world. Both proessional nd amateur entertainment in the theatre, concert hall and further education centres are readily available to the mobile villager in the surrounding towns and cities. For those not content with the pleasures the TV and radio provide at home, the village offers a variety of outside meetings.
